scripts.certs:sudo: [ "$EUID" -ne 0 ] && echo '\033[0;43mYou will need to run the command in sudo.\033[0m\nNPM command -> \033[0;32msudo npm run certs\033[0m' && npm run certs:sudo:clipboard && exit 1 || npm run certs:generate
scripts.certs:sudo:clipboard: sh -c 'CMD="sudo npm run certs" && (echo "$CMD" | pbcopy || echo "$CMD" | xclip -selection clipboard || echo "$CMD" | clip) && echo "\033[0;32m${CMD}\033[0m \033[0;37m <-- has been copied to your clipboard\033[0m"'
scripts.certs:generate: run-s certs:env certs:clean certs:mkdir certs:ssl certs:chmod certs:port certs:vars certs:clean certs:success
scripts.certs:ssl: sudo openssl req -x509 -nodes -days 365 -newkey rsa:2048 -keyout certs/selfsigned.key -out certs/selfsigned.crt
scripts.certs:success: echo '\033[0;42mCertificates have been generated\033[0m\033[32m\nYou can now run the following command to start the server:\033[0m\nNPM command -> \033[0;32mnpm run dev:https\033[0m' && npm run certs:success:clipboard
scripts.certs:success:clipboard: sh -c 'CMD="npm run dev:https" && (echo "$CMD" | pbcopy || echo "$CMD" | xclip -selection clipboard || echo "$CMD" | clip) && echo "\033[0;32m${CMD}\033[0m \033[0;37m <-- has been copied to your clipboard\033[0m"'
scripts.heroku-prebuild: echo This runs before Heroku installs dependencies.
scripts.heroku-postbuild: echo This runs after Heroku installs dependencies, but before Heroku prunes and caches dependencies.
scripts.heroku-cleanup: echo This runs after Heroku prunes and caches dependencies.
